OrinFlamingFist.synopsis: |Standing quietly behind the Big Barn, Rowan is just trying to do his job and maybe avoid getting too involved with the refugees and locals that are making a fuss on the other side of the building.  He’s not the most courageous, and certainly not hard-working, but his job isn’t exactly fascinating right now. |
OrinFlamingFist.how_to_trigger: 1) Open debugbook2) Got to Region3) Act 34) Wyrm's Crossing5) Refugee Camp6.0) oe OIStartOrinFlamingFist to start the dialog (do the other steps below first if you want them enabled)6.1) oe OIEnableOrinFlamingFist to enable journal as Orin6.2) oe OIMetOrinOnce to enable that you've met Orin in previous impersonation.

AD_Smith.synopsis: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith has a smithy in the center of Rivington. He is working on his forge.This is the AD that is being played while he works, Orin will also use the same AD while she is impersonating him.

PAD_Smith_BloodSpot.synopsis: Orin had impersonated the Smith. And tried to frame the players by impersonating them and attacking the Smith - in the effort to get the players to kill the Smith. If the players had succeeded in de-escalating the situation with the Smith. Orin will return on LongRest (or when players travel to LOW) and kill off the Smith anyways.This PAD is triggered when players are near the bloodstain marks of where the Smith usually is. His body can later be found in Bhaal Temple.
PAD_Smith_BloodSpot.how_to_trigger: 1) Start new game2) Go to Wyrm's Crossing Smithy. (-2.328; 49.031; -49.241)3) Encounter OrinSmith and she'll eventually teleport away.4) RealSmith should awaken and confront the player.5) Talk to him and succeed the skill check to de-escalate the situation with him.6) Long-Rest.7) He should have disappeared and a puddle of blood is where he used to be.8) PAD should occur when you are nearby the bloodpuddle.

Smith.synopsis: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith unknowingstly was knocked unconcious by Orin the Red.  He only awakes once Orin the Red has teleported away - leaving the players with the awkward circumstance of being at his smithy.  He views the players with suspicion until convinced either-wise.
Smith.how_to_trigger: 1) Goto 12.1, -51.6, -51 or bookmark "BGO_Rivington_AngleIronSmithy".2) Encounter with Orin who's disguised as the smith.3) After the encounter, the real Smith will appear and talk to the players.

SmithOrin.synopsis: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith, a crusty human male, runs his smithy in the center of Rivington called Angleiron Smithy.He usually greets potential customers in front of his smithy. But today, Orin the Red, perverse and malicious, has assumed his likeness and identity to greet the unsuspecting players.This is her way of learning about the players in person, to tailor-made a death just for them.
SmithOrin.how_to_trigger: 1) Use the bookmark BGO_Rivington_AngleIronSmithy2) Talk to the Gyldro Angleiron the Smith

AD_Journalist.synopsis: Lens the Journalist is near the checkpoint at the South Checkpoint. She is taking notes and observing intently to the happenings around her.This is the AD that's been repeated as she stands there. Orin will also use this AD when she impersonates Lens.

PAD_PostImpersonation.synopsis: Orin may impersonate several people in Wyrm's Crossing. The possible impersonations are :-- The Smith in Rivington- Lens the Journalist near Southcheck Point.- LoveDryad in the circus- Rowan the Flaming Fist at the big barn.- DyingAttacker at the Smuggler's Cave.Instead of these NPCs, Orin may take their place and impersonate them. This PAD dialog is meant to be played after she reveals herselfs and teleports away. First one should recognise Orin by name (to help the player), and acknowledge her shapeshifting ability. Second can be more flexible, wondering why she's doing it.
PAD_PostImpersonation.how_to_trigger: This triggers in Wyrm's Crossing after an encounter with one of Orin's Impersonations.1) Gyldro Angleiron the Smith near the center of Rivington. (-7.119; 49.958; -58.56)2) Lens the Journalist near the entrance of the checkpoint. (6.372; 41.108; 23.997)3) Rowan the Flaming Fist near the back entrance of Big Barn near the refugee camp. (101.814; 44.018; -115.137)4) DyingAttacker (Dying Stone Lord Thug) near the entrance of the Smugglers Cave. (-142.784; 3.656; 72.951)5) Zethino the Love Dryad in the Circus. (-57.016; 45.094; -52.712)

OrinDyingAttacker.synopsis: Eroll was already having a bad day, considering he is the poor impaled soul in the Smuggler’s Cave who’s begging you to help the guild members fighting the Stone Man’s men.  After said begging, he actually dies in front of your eyes.
OrinDyingAttacker.how_to_trigger: 1) Open debugbook2) Got to Region3) Act 34) Wyrm's Crossing5) Start6.0) oe OIStartOrinDyingAttacker to start the dialog (do the other steps below first if you want them enabled)6.1) oe OIEnableOrinDyingAttacker to enable journal as Orin6.2) oe OIMetOrinOnce to enable that you've met Orin in previous impersonation.

AD_SmithAwakens.synopsis: The smith was knocked unconcious by Orin.  He comes to after Orin teleports away.  And walks towards the players.
AD_SmithAwakens.how_to_trigger: 1) Wait for Orin to teleport away.2) Smith will appear3) Triggers this dialog.

Journalist.synopsis: At the end of the queue leading to the South span’s checkpoint is a young journalist taking note and quotes from the poor souls trying to get into Baldur’s Gate.This is her normal state.
Journalist.how_to_trigger: To start this Dialog.1) Go to Act 3 - Wyrm's Crossing - Anywhere2) oe OIStartJournalist

LINE_OrinAttacked.synopsis: Players attacked Orin unprovoked while she was impersonating another person. She likes this bloodthirsty nature towards indiscriminate violence.She can be attacked this way in 3 different encounters. Each time she increasing likes the player's nature towards the violence.She teleports away after commenting this.
LINE_OrinAttacked.how_to_trigger: Attack Orin in any of the 3 encounters you have with her.

OrinJournalist.synopsis: At the end of the queue leading to the South span’s checkpoint is a young journalist taking note and quotes from the poor souls trying to get into Baldur’s Gate.Lens, a female tiefling in a worn overcoat, can simply be a quiet news worker taking the beat of the outside city (because someone has to tell the true story).
OrinJournalist.how_to_trigger: 1) Open debugbook2) Got to Region3) Act 34) Wyrm's Crossing5) Bridge Checkpoint6.0) oe OIStartOrinJournalist to start the dialog (do the other steps below first if you want them enabled)6.1) oe OIEnableOrinJournalist to enable journal as Orin6.2) oe OIMetOrinOnce to enable that you've met Orin in previous impersonation.

OrinFlamingFist_49.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_49.text: Hail, friend. Fine day, isn't it?

OrinFlamingFist_34.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_34.text: Forgive me - you're in no mood to talk about the weather. Your journey here was a hard one, no doubt.

OrinFlamingFist_44.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_44.text: Is this your first time in Baldur's Gate?

OrinFlamingFist_4.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_4.text: It is. I can't believe I'm finally here.

OrinFlamingFist_3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_3.text: Well, whatever you've heard - the reality might not be quite so rosy.
OrinFlamingFist_3.context: NodeContext: with a sigh, this fact pains him

OrinFlamingFist_38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_38.text: Used to be you'd arrive knowing you'd a full belly and a warm bed waiting for you. Not any more.

OrinFlamingFist_60.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_60.text: These days, there's barely enough to go around. Add the refugees on top and... well, folk aren't feeling too generous.

OrinFlamingFist_28.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_28.text: I'm not surprised. Tensions seem high around here.

OrinFlamingFist_99.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_99.text: Some well-to-do's in the city donated enough to see the newcomers right for the time being. Only they didn't bother helping everyone else.

OrinFlamingFist_103.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_103.text: Locals going without while strangers feast - it's stoked the fire, all right. Some Baldurians are kicking up a fuss round the front of the barn as we speak.

OrinFlamingFist_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_35.text: If I wasn't wearing this uniform, I'd walk round there and teach them a lesson they'd never forget.

OrinFlamingFist_93.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_93.text: The people of this city have grown selfish. They need reminding what true hardship is.

OrinFlamingFist_32.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
OrinFlamingFist_32.text: We can be the reminder. Soft citizens make easy targets.

OrinFlamingFist_21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_21.text: Too bloody right. They've gone soft behind those walls, forgotten what it's like to struggle, living hand-to-mouth.
OrinFlamingFist_21.context: NodeContext: releasing a pent up anger

OrinFlamingFist_5.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_5.text: If the refugees have more than they need, it's only fair they give some back.

OrinFlamingFist_53.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_53.text: Too bloody right. But will they share? Not a chance.

OrinFlamingFist_11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_11.text: Those refugees have been leeching on our city for too long. If we don't show them we mean business, they'll bleed us dry.
OrinFlamingFist_11.context: NodeContext: releasing a pent up anger

OrinFlamingFist_91.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_91.text: I'm all in favour of re-education. It sounds like they have a lot to learn.

OrinFlamingFist_8.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_8.text: I knew you'd feel the same way.

OrinFlamingFist_13.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_13.text: We need to march round the front, and kill every last one of them. Let's see them eat our food with their guts on the floor. What do you say?

OrinFlamingFist_41.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_41.text: They're innocent people. You can't just kill them!

OrinFlamingFist_15.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_15.text: Why does it matter? Innocence makes the blood run clearer.

OrinFlamingFist_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Flaming Fist  transforms into Orin. Long transform.

OrinFlamingFist_101.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_101.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
OrinFlamingFist_101.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

OrinFlamingFist_48.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_48.text: Yours is a crude and clumsy violence, sibling. You'll hack a jagged path through this city to reach me.
OrinFlamingFist_48.context: NodeContext: Player previously agreed to massacre innocent people. Judging - thinks you're a brute, but curious to see the carnage you leave in your wake

OrinFlamingFist_81.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_81.text: I could end it now - but I'll be patient. Father will see us together again. He will see you bleed.
OrinFlamingFist_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Toying with the player, trying to make them uneasy, establish her power over them. 'Father' is Bhaal.

OrinFlamingFist_78.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_78.text: Have you lost your nerve, my blood-starved sibling?  Did I mangle your skull too terribly?
OrinFlamingFist_78.context: NodeContext: Player previously refused to kill civilians. Mocking - finds this pathetic. 'Mangle your skull' refers to her putting the tadpole in your brain

OrinFlamingFist_37.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_37.text: So you're the lickspittle who crushed the Bone Lord's thrall.
OrinFlamingFist_37.context: NodeContext: First time Orin meets player. 'Bone Lord's thrall' is Ketheric, who player previously killed. Curious.

OrinFlamingFist_52.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_52.text: Have you come beg-begging, sniffing for our stones? Gortash won't like that. A throat his black hand can't choke the spit from.
OrinFlamingFist_52.context: NodeContext: Mocking, finds your plan ridiculous but enjoys the chaos it will cause. 'Stones' are the netherstones. 'Black hand' reference to the 'Black Hand of Bane', Gortash's god.

OrinFlamingFist_67.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_67.text: He will tremble at your slaughter. So eager to spill the guts from this city.
OrinFlamingFist_67.context: NodeContext: 'He' is Gortash. Player agreed to massacre innocent people. Orin excited to see the chaos you leave in your wake

OrinFlamingFist_39.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_39.text: You'll need to bleed and carve this city if you want to turn him to grave meat. He shivers at the thought.

OrinFlamingFist_77.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_77.text: When you find the lordling, tell him Orin is watching.
OrinFlamingFist_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Playful, menacing. Trying to make player uneasy - she could be hiding anywhere.

OrinFlamingFist_54.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_54.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.
OrinFlamingFist_54.context: NodeContext: Second time Orin appeared to toy with you. She can't believe you're wasting so much time.

OrinFlamingFist_84.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_84.text: Do not worry, slaughter kin. My blades are still sharp and sweet. They will greet you soon enough.
OrinFlamingFist_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Mocking reassurance - trying to make the player uneasy.

OrinFlamingFist_17.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_17.text: Still rolling in the muck, I see.

OrinFlamingFist_12.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_12.text: Gortash knows you are coming. Knows you have the Bone Lord's stone. Do not let him hiss hot air into your worm-weakened brain.
OrinFlamingFist_12.context: NodeContext: Acting like she's helping you, but just trying to freak you out. 'Bone Lord's stone' is Ketheric's netherstone

OrinFlamingFist_57.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinFlamingFist_57.text: Remember - his throat spits lies, but my blade carves the truth. You will read it on your skin soon enough.
OrinFlamingFist_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: toying with the player, knows the 'truth' about them and is enjoying holding this against them

OrinFlamingFist_16.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_16.text: You're speaking my language. I'm in.

OrinFlamingFist_22.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_22.text: What a wonderful language it is. Bleeding. Slicing. Snapping. Goring. They taste divine on my tongue.

OrinFlamingFist_88.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_88.text: Both sides need teaching a lesson: let's kill them all.

OrinFlamingFist_69.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_69.text: Yes, yes, yes! Slit and slice and chop and bleed them. Not a soul left alive!

OrinFlamingFist_18.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_18.text: You're a monster. I'm reporting you to your commanding officer.

OrinFlamingFist_26.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_26.text: Tell them! I'll cut out their eyes and make them watch.

OrinFlamingFist_25.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_25.text: I kill discreetly and with purpose. Openly murdering refugees seems rather clumsy.

OrinFlamingFist_50.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_50.text: You think there's a better way? Such sickening naivety, but I will cure you of it.

OrinFlamingFist_20.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_20.text: A quick solution to an annoying problem. Count me in.

OrinFlamingFist_98.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_98.text: I kill discreetly and with purpose. Openly slaughtering civilians is hardly my chosen approach.

OrinFlamingFist_83.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_83.text: I won't be party to your wanton fantasy.

OrinFlamingFist_72.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_72.text: You might be surprised. I've known people to bite - fight back.

OrinFlamingFist_76.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_76.text: I hope they do. The more they fight, the quicker the blood will spill.

OrinFlamingFist_95.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_95.text: I will do better than mindless slaughter: it is not the answer.

OrinFlamingFist_65.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_65.text: Mindless slaughter is the only answer.

OrinFlamingFist_0.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_0.text: Let's soak the earth with entrails, kill and kill again!

OrinFlamingFist_80.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_80.text: Hardly the most satisfying opponents. I'll save my energy for a real fight.

OrinFlamingFist_29.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_29.text: People here have gone soft living behind the city walls, forgotten what it's like live one day from destruction.
OrinFlamingFist_29.context: NodeContext: releasing a pent up anger

OrinFlamingFist_85.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_85.text: I say we march round there and slit a few bellies. Remind them how much worse things could be. What do you say?

OrinFlamingFist_96.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_96.text: You're supposed to keep the peace, not stoke the fire.

OrinFlamingFist_63.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_63.text: What peace? If no one steps in, there'll be bodies piled high in the streets before long.

OrinFlamingFist_56.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_56.text: I'd think your uniform would be enough to make them quieten down.

OrinFlamingFist_66.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_66.text: The Flaming Fist isn't what it used to be. It's grown weak, corruptible, soft.

OrinFlamingFist_104.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_104.text: It's down to honest citizens like me to stand up for what's right, uniform or no. That lot round front - they've got it coming to them.

OrinFlamingFist_30.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_30.text: I didn't come looking for handouts. I take care of myself.

OrinFlamingFist_89.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_89.text: That might be the simplest approach. Unfortunately, not everyone sees things that way.

OrinFlamingFist_1.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_1.text: I've got ways of making people share.

OrinFlamingFist_46.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_46.text: The way things are going, it might well come to that.

OrinFlamingFist_40.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_40.text: Is there anything I can do to ease these people's burden?

OrinFlamingFist_79.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_79.text: I've been asking myself the same question. I wouldn't be the first to interfere.

OrinFlamingFist_58.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_58.text: Sounds like that's your problem, not mine.

OrinFlamingFist_47.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_47.text: If it were my problem, I'd do something about it. Instead they've stuck me guarding this door while they squabble over the donations.

OrinFlamingFist_19.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_19.text: I've passed through, but I'm a Waterdeep man at heart.

OrinFlamingFist_100.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_100.text: A word of advice then - you might not get as warm a welcome as in days gone by.
OrinFlamingFist_100.context: NodeContext: with a sigh, this fact pains him

OrinFlamingFist_9.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_9.text: Yes. I'm almost entirely sure I'm a Baldurian.

OrinFlamingFist_51.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_51.text: It's a fine city, isn't it? No better place to hail from.

OrinFlamingFist_97.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_97.text: My home is somewhere. I must live here.

OrinFlamingFist_6.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_6.text: You do? My apologies. It's usually newcomers who seek my aid, though with the way the city's been recently, they've been staying away in droves.

OrinFlamingFist_105.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_105.text: I think... I think I have been here. Although I don't remember it much.

OrinFlamingFist_43.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_43.text: Is that so? Enigmatic soul, aren't you?

OrinFlamingFist_23.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_23.text: Not my first, but hopefully my last. It's not the most salubrious of destinations.

OrinFlamingFist_7.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_7.text: Ah. Maybe our city's finer qualities can win you over yet, though I'll admit, they're in short supply at the moment.

OrinFlamingFist_73.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_73.text: Yes, I heard the streets were paved with gold... the coin purses, too.

OrinFlamingFist_71.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_71.text: Sure. Never been before - anyone tells you differently, they're lying.

OrinFlamingFist_75.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_75.text: Plenty of times. Got the scars to prove it.

OrinFlamingFist_74.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_74.text: It's best to not ask where I conduct my... business. For your own safety.

OrinFlamingFist_94.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_94.text: My past is none of your concern.

OrinFlamingFist_42.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_42.text: No offence intended, just being friendly. You won't find many make others making the effort.

OrinFlamingFist_59.speaker: Player
OrinFlamingFist_59.text: Do they pay you extra to act so godsdamned cheerful?

OrinFlamingFist_33.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_FlamingFist
OrinFlamingFist_33.text: Of course not. But most folk appreciate a kind word these days.

AD_Smith_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
AD_Smith_0.text: I'm sweating more than Balduran's balls.
AD_Smith_0.context: NodeContext: muttering to himself while he works at a forge

AD_Smith_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
AD_Smith_1.text: Stronger than a Steel Watcher. Guaranteed!
AD_Smith_1.context: NodeContext: a sales pitch, shouted to passersby as he works

AD_Smith_2.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
AD_Smith_2.context: NodeContext: proudly admiring his work at a forge

AD_Smith_3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
AD_Smith_3.context: NodeContext: a sales pitch, shouted to passersby as he works

PAD_Smith_BloodSpot_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Smith_BloodSpot_0.text: There's blood here, not yet dried. And no sign of the smith...

Smith_12.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_12.text: You! Try attacking me when my back isn't turned, you bloody coward!
Smith_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith comes running out of the smithy, one hand to the back of his head, the other clutching an iron bar like a weapon. He spots the player - accuses them.NodeContext: Accusing

Smith_73.speaker: Player
Smith_73.text: I didn't attack you - I've been out here the whole time.

Smith_14.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_14.text: Don't dare lie to me. I saw you with my own eyes, grinning at me like some bloody imbecile.

Smith_47.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_47.text: I'm going to knock that smirk right off your face.
Smith_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Physically threatening in some way (e.g. pointing a finger at the player)NodeContext: Threatening

Smith_15.speaker: Player
Smith_15.text: I'm telling you, it was a doppelganger!

Smith_34.speaker: Player
Smith_34.text: Brave words for a man harbouring wanted terrorists in his cellar.

Smith_75.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_75.text: Terrorists? Is that why you belted me over the head?

Smith_16.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_16.text: Those gnomes are victims. They've spent years in exile, no forge to call their own, all because of some ancient bloody grudge.

Smith_3.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_3.text: The Gondians think they're the only ones fit to swing a hammer round here. They're wrong. One day they'll learn that the hard way.

Smith_41.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_41.text: Until that happens, I'll give those Ironhands a roof over their heads. Nothing wrong with it.

Smith_46.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_46.text: Go on - take your thuggery elsewhere. Bloody animal.

Smith_64.speaker: Player
Smith_64.text: I know it's hard to believe, but you really were attacked by a doppelganger.

Smith_21.speaker: Player
Smith_21.text: You must have been attacked by my twin. They're a real handful.

Smith_69.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_69.text: Well, you'd better knock some sense into that bloody thug, before I do.
Smith_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxes a little - he's accepted you're not the one responsible.NodeContext: Still threatening, but knows you're not responsible

Smith_7.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_7.text: Hard enough trying to make a bloody living without some moron cracking your skull for no good reason.

Smith_6.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_6.text: A liar AND a thug. It's time someone beat some bloody respect into you.
Smith_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tense, ready to fight the playerNodeContext: Threatening, leading into a fight

Smith_70.speaker: Player
Smith_70.text: Try it, and you'll be smiling without teeth for the rest of your life.

Smith_63.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_63.text: You know what? Not worth it.
Smith_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: The blacksmith drops his guard, adopts a more peaceful stanceNodeContext: Scared, but trying to sound like he's still in control

Smith_61.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_61.text: Spoken like the vicious scum you are.

Smith_26.speaker: Player
Smith_26.text: You had a blow to the head. Are you sure you're remembering correctly?

Smith_55.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_55.text: Well - I - I'm sure it was you. Almost certain...
Smith_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Relaxes a little - he's accepted you're not the one responsible.NodeContext: Thrown - aggressive but losing confidence fast

Smith_22.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_22.text: Oh Gods be damned, I don't know. I'd have sworn but - my head's pounding, I don't remember.
Smith_22.context: NodeContext: Still annoyed, but accepting he can't prove anything.

Smith_40.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_40.text: I need a bloody drink. Go on - clear off. I've seen enough of your face today.
Smith_40.context: NodeContext: Final - I'm done with the conversation

Smith_67.speaker: Player
Smith_67.text: Hallucinations. Irrational anger. These are symptoms of a serious head injury.

Smith_36.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_36.text: You're not wrong. Feels like my brain's been drawn on the anvil.
Smith_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: He slumps, putting a hand to his head.NodeContext: Frustrated, remembering his pain

Smith_48.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_48.text: And we both know who bloody gave them to me, don't we?

Smith_13.speaker: Player
Smith_13.text: You were attacked by a doppelganger. She was impersonating me.

Smith_25.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_25.text: Is that so? You've got some evil twin running round whacking people round the back of the head?
Smith_25.context: NodeContext: Furious, and NOW you're lying to him

Smith_43.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_43.text: I tell you now - you'll be seeing bloody double when I'm done with you.
Smith_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Physically threatening in some way (e.g. pointing a finger at the player)NodeContext: Threatening

Smith_56.speaker: Player
Smith_56.text: What in the nine Hells are you talking about?

Smith_49.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_49.text: Now you're acting innocent are you? After you near caved my bloody skull in?

Smith_59.speaker: Player
Smith_59.text: Go on. Say that again. Like you really, really mean it...

Smith_31.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_31.text: I- I don't need to. I know what you did, whacking me over the head. Near caved my skull in!

Smith_33.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_33.context: NodeContext: Not happy  - "why the hell are you still bothering me?"

Smith_0.speaker: Player
Smith_0.text: I want to know why you're harbouring Ironhand Gnomes in your cellar.

Smith_27.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_27.text: Now clear off. You want anything else - go to the shop. I've got work to do.

Smith_58.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_58.text: Then go down to the bloody shop. I've got work to do.

Smith_39.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_39.text: Please - keep bothering me. I've no work to get on with.
Smith_39.context: NodeContext: "Are you serious?" - Barely disguised sarcasm

Smith_51.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_51.text: If you're a customer, go down to the shop. Otherwise - clear off.

Smith_74.speaker: Player
Smith_74.text: I want to know why you're harbouring Ironhand Gnomes in your cellar.

Smith_62.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_62.text: Been poking around downstairs have you? Well I've got nothing to hide.

Smith_17.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_17.text: Well, given this is in fact a blacksmiths, we sell things that need smithing.

Smith_9.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_9.text: My shopkeeper can tell you more. Give the lazy sod something to do for once.
Smith_9.context: NodeContext: dismissing you - this is a waste of time

Smith_30.speaker: Player
Smith_30.text: Watch your tone. No one speaks to me that way.

Smith_68.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
Smith_68.text: Oh, I'm very sorry. If you're offended, feel free to make a complaint.

SmithOrin_70.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_70.text: Welcome, adventurer! I take it you're new to Rivington.

SmithOrin_64.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_64.text: No doubt you came here to choose from my fine selection of weapons?

SmithOrin_38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_38.text: Yes, I seem to have it all. Clubs, swords, maces, bows. Cutting and gutting galore.

SmithOrin_45.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_45.text: Why don't we see if we can find the perfect weapon for you?

SmithOrin_8.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_8.text: How will you know my perfect weapon?

SmithOrin_53.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_53.text: I provide a personalised service for my customers. To make sure the weapon I choose is the perfect fit.

SmithOrin_73.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_73.text: So long as it comes with a very generous discount.

SmithOrin_59.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_59.text: My weapons are a bargain at any price.

SmithOrin_0.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_0.text: All right. Show me what you have.

SmithOrin_61.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_61.text: Wonderful. But, patience is a virtue.

SmithOrin_44.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_44.text: No thanks. I've got everything I need.

SmithOrin_72.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_72.text: I'm not sure. Something is missing. A hole that only a blade can fill, perhaps.

SmithOrin_30.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_30.text: Let's get to know each other a little better. Perhaps I can make you a customer yet.

SmithOrin_76.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_76.text: Tell me, how do you like to kill?

SmithOrin_16.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_16.text: Slowly and painfully. I like to see the fear in their eyes.

SmithOrin_97.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SmithOrin_97.text: Seems you've been paying more attention to my techniques than I realised. I am flattered.

SmithOrin_83.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_83.text: Fear is the best part, isn't it? To see them realise their life is over, its final moments nothing but agony.

SmithOrin_6.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_6.text: Quickly and efficiently. I don't want anyone to suffer.

SmithOrin_85.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SmithOrin_85.text: You make killing sound quite dull. Where's the passion?

SmithOrin_21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_21.text: Come - we're all friends here. No need to pretend you don't like to twist the knife.

SmithOrin_19.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_19.text: And when you kill someone, what do you feel?

SmithOrin_5.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_5.text: Good answer. To kill is the closest thing to knowing the power of the gods themselves.

SmithOrin_29.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_29.text: One more question, if you'll humour me.

SmithOrin_20.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_20.text: Do you think you could turn your weapon on those closest to you?

SmithOrin_100.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_100.text: This weapon must be fit for every kill. Even the ones you never think will come.

SmithOrin_32.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_32.text: So, answer me honestly. Could you kill one you loved?

SmithOrin_81.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_81.text: Perhaps. If there was no other option.

SmithOrin_10.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_10.text: There's a killer inside you, isn't there? It wouldn't take much to push you over the edge.

SmithOrin_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

SmithOrin_57.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_57.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
SmithOrin_57.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

SmithOrin_68.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_68.text: I've been watching. Waiting. Seeing how you lead your lambs skip-skipping to the slaughter.
SmithOrin_68.context: NodeContext: Toying with the player, thinks they're wasting time indulging their companions. Player previously said they could kill a friend.

SmithOrin_41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_41.text: Weak and soft and broken. Oh, sweet sibling, the world has dulled you. Or maybe I poked your mind matter too sharply.
SmithOrin_41.context: NodeContext: Mocking - the player said they would never kill a friend, which Orin finds pathetic. Allusion to the fact she put the tadpole in their skull.

SmithOrin_43.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_43.text: I could end it now - but I'll be patient. Father will see us together again. He will see you bleed.
SmithOrin_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Toying with the player, trying to make them uneasy, establish her power over them. 'Father' is Bhaal.

SmithOrin_80.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_80.text: So you're the lickspittle who crushed the Bone Lord's thrall.
SmithOrin_80.context: NodeContext: First time Orin meets player. 'Bone Lord's thrall' is Ketheric, who player previously killed. Curious.

SmithOrin_74.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_74.text: Have you come beg-begging, sniffing for our stones? Gortash won't like that. A throat his black hand can't choke the spit from.
SmithOrin_74.context: NodeContext: Mocking, finds your plan ridiculous but enjoys the chaos it will cause. 'Stones' are the netherstones. 'Black hand' reference to the 'Black Hand of Bane', Gortash's god.

SmithOrin_65.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_65.text: You could kill him. Let him close and make him feel the tickle of your blade between his ribs.
SmithOrin_65.context: NodeContext: Player previously said they would kill friend. Orin encouraging this thought - playful.

SmithOrin_25.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_25.text: When you find the lordling, tell him Orin is watching.
SmithOrin_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Playful, menacing. Trying to make player uneasy - she could be hiding anywhere.

SmithOrin_77.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_77.text: He'll find your weaknesses. Stick a knife in the cracks and prise you apart. Unless you get him first.
SmithOrin_77.context: NodeContext: Player previously said they wouldn't kill friend. Orin thinks them pathetic, but is amused at the thought of you trying to take on Gortash.

SmithOrin_9.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_9.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.
SmithOrin_9.context: NodeContext: Second time Orin appeared to toy with you. She can't believe you're wasting so much time.

SmithOrin_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_35.text: Do not worry, slaughter kin. My blades are still sharp and sweet. They will greet you soon enough.
SmithOrin_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Mocking reassurance - trying to make the player uneasy.

SmithOrin_96.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_96.text: Still rolling in the muck, I see.

SmithOrin_27.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_27.text: Gortash knows you are coming. Knows you have the Bone Lord's stone. Do not let him hiss hot air into your worm-weakened brain.
SmithOrin_27.context: NodeContext: Acting like she's helping you, but just trying to freak you out. 'Bone Lord's stone' is Ketheric's netherstone

SmithOrin_79.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
SmithOrin_79.text: Remember - his throat spits lies, but my blade carves the truth. You will read it on your skin soon enough.
SmithOrin_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: toying with the player, knows the 'truth' about them and is enjoying holding this against them

SmithOrin_99.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_99.text: I would never kill someone I cared about.

SmithOrin_67.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_67.text: You'll do so much worse, by the time I'm done with you.
SmithOrin_67.context: NodeContext: With a smile, ominous - picturing the horrors she'll inflict on you

SmithOrin_58.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_58.text: You deny yourself, but it won't last. It's in your blood.
SmithOrin_58.context: NodeContext: Menacing/amused by your refusal. Thinks you're weak for resisting your nature.

SmithOrin_71.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_71.text: Marvellous. You treat your friends as a butcher leading cattle to the slaughter.

SmithOrin_48.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_48.text: You had Father's offer. His glory was in reach, and you cowered like a babe.

SmithOrin_75.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_75.text: Alliances change and change and change again. Friend today, dead tomorrow.

SmithOrin_22.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_22.text: I know what you do to your allies - smiling as the blade slips between the bones, lip-licking as the insides tumble out.

SmithOrin_94.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_94.text: Bold of you to assume anyone is that close to me.

SmithOrin_66.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_66.text: So you string your mewlings along with falsehoods. Such sweet, bloody betrayal you offer them.

SmithOrin_102.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_102.text: Then you know how beautiful betrayal tastes on the tongue. Delicious.

SmithOrin_90.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_90.text: I do all I can to keep my loved ones safe from my blade.

SmithOrin_56.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_56.text: You can't stop yourself any more than stop your blood pumping. You delay the inevitable.

SmithOrin_103.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_103.text: A deep sadness. I take no enjoyment in it.

SmithOrin_49.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_49.text: You deny yourself the sweetest pleasures. But that can change, given the right circumstances.

SmithOrin_36.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_36.text: Relieved, usually. It's kill or be killed, and I intend to survive.

SmithOrin_28.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_28.text: I can see it in your eyes, though - you can't help feeling a tingle of pleasure all the same.

SmithOrin_104.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_104.text: Exhilarated beyond compare. It is my purpose.

SmithOrin_88.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_88.text: Sated, as if my parched throat has been fully quenched.

SmithOrin_46.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_46.text: It is a pleasure, isn't it? Warm and sweet and sticky.

SmithOrin_87.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_87.text: I feel nothing. It's like I'm not even present.

SmithOrin_98.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_98.text: Really? That detachment must be so liberating. Who knows what you're capable of?

SmithOrin_34.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_34.text: Bold. Brave, even - if the kill is just.

SmithOrin_82.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_82.text: You take comfort in knowing your foes deserve their fate? It must be wonderful, indulging in such righteous slaughter.

SmithOrin_4.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_4.text: Certainty. If I kill, it is because my god demanded it.

SmithOrin_92.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_92.text: Killing holds no fear for you, does it? You understand what it takes, and what it gives.

SmithOrin_60.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_60.text: Why do you need to know this?

SmithOrin_37.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_37.text: Call it professional curiosity. Now tell me - how does killing make you feel?

SmithOrin_50.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_50.text: I've had enough. I'll buy my weapons elsewhere.

SmithOrin_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_1.text: Oh you're no fun at all, are you?

SmithOrin_78.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_78.text: Depends who I'm killing, and how much they've pissed me off.

SmithOrin_54.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_54.text: Oh, good answer. Killing is so much more satisfying when you really mean it.

SmithOrin_23.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_23.text: It flows through me as raw inspiration, I never know what my next kill will look like.

SmithOrin_26.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SmithOrin_26.text: That is why you make for such delightful company.

SmithOrin_62.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_62.text: Such imagery. You are an artist with a weapon in your hand, I can tell.

SmithOrin_101.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_101.text: With maximum carnage. Killing is a duty. But spilling blood is a thrill.

SmithOrin_17.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_17.text: I wield my faith as my god demands. Without hesitation or doubt.

SmithOrin_24.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_24.text: I see. Playing to your strengths. Keeping things simple.

SmithOrin_39.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_39.text: I don't see what this has to do with me buying a weapon from you.

SmithOrin_89.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_89.text: Oh, it's all part of the service. Everybody answers.

SmithOrin_18.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Smith
SmithOrin_18.text: Go on. Tell me how you kill.

SmithOrin_51.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_51.text: I'm not buying anything. Now back off.

SmithOrin_7.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_7.text: I'm not buying anything. Now back off.

SmithOrin_33.speaker: Player
SmithOrin_33.text: I'm not buying anything. Now back off.

AD_Journalist_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
AD_Journalist_0.context: NodeContext: To self, making notes - excited by what she's writing

AD_Journalist_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
AD_Journalist_1.context: NodeContext: To self, making notes - excited by what she's writing

AD_Journalist_2.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
AD_Journalist_2.context: NodeContext: To self, making notes - excited by what she's writing

AD_Journalist_3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
AD_Journalist_3.context: NodeContext: To self, making notes - determined

PAD_PostImpersonation_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PostImpersonation_0.text: She's toying with me. What does she want?

PAD_PostImpersonation_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PostImpersonation_1.text: So Orin is a shapeshifter. How long has she been watching?

OrinDyingAttacker_14.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_14.text: Ungh... Come to finish the job?
OrinDyingAttacker_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The injured man is pinned to an upright piece of driftwood by a sword rammed through his belly.[LOGAN] Please check with Greg for V.O pose - please try to match as close as possibleNodeContext: Wincing, in serious pain

OrinDyingAttacker_22.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_22.text: An idiot, that's who. Started a fight I couldn't bloody win.

OrinDyingAttacker_6.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_6.text: Picked the wrong fight. Gave the bastard something to cry about though.

OrinDyingAttacker_43.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_43.text: Argh. By the gods... it hurts. Help me, please.

OrinDyingAttacker_40.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_40.text: No! It's too late for that... No potion or spell can fix this...
OrinDyingAttacker_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player moves as if about to heal the dying attacker, but the attacker throws up a hand, telling them to stop.NodeContext: Wincing, in serious pain

OrinDyingAttacker_21.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_21.text: What do you want me to do?

OrinDyingAttacker_50.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_50.text: Finish this. I can't stand the pain any longer.

OrinDyingAttacker_65.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_65.text: I don't want saving... I want death.

OrinDyingAttacker_67.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_67.text: My 'help' tends to end with someone dead.

OrinDyingAttacker_25.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_25.text: Can't imagine worse than this. Argh.

OrinDyingAttacker_49.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_49.text: Spin the blade: twist and toy with it.

OrinDyingAttacker_9.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_9.text: Stop. Stop! Please... just end this.
OrinDyingAttacker_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches out towards the man, prodding his injury (unseen). The man grimaces in agony.NodeContext: In agony, as somebody pokes his wounds

OrinDyingAttacker_15.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_15.text: Get this blade out of me... Use it... Kill me... kill me NOW.

OrinDyingAttacker_2.speaker: Narrator
OrinDyingAttacker_2.text: *There's something strange about the man dying before your eyes. Though in agony, he seems to be enjoying this.*

OrinDyingAttacker_66.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_66.text: Why are you so eager to die? What's going on here?

OrinDyingAttacker_0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_0.text: If you had your guts falling out... you'd be eager too.

OrinDyingAttacker_8.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_8.text: I'll stay with you until the end, but I won't speed your passage.

OrinDyingAttacker_57.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_57.text: What's the hurry? I'll enjoy watching you die slowly.

OrinDyingAttacker_51.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_51.text: That's it... Watch the life drip drop away.
OrinDyingAttacker_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dying man grins.NodeContext: maniacal

OrinDyingAttacker_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dying man transforms into Orin. Long transform.

OrinDyingAttacker_27.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_27.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
OrinDyingAttacker_27.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

OrinDyingAttacker_44.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_44.text: Even with your head meat tumbled, you tickle and torture so brutishly. A blunt and tasteless slaughter.
OrinDyingAttacker_44.context: NodeContext: Player chose to violently killl a dying man. 'Head meat tumbled' alluding to her tadpoling your brain. Orin judging your technique to be poor

OrinDyingAttacker_54.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_54.text: Do you only kill with kindness, sibling? Is your head meat so tumbled and tormented?
OrinDyingAttacker_54.context: NodeContext: Player chose to mercy kill the dying man. Mocking - "poor baby". 'Head meat' referring to tadpoling your brain.

OrinDyingAttacker_32.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_32.text: Is this the blood-starved mercy you come to offer me, sibling? I have none to offer you.
OrinDyingAttacker_32.context: NodeContext: Player refused to kill the dying man. Orin finds this pathetic, mocking the idea that they would refuse to kill her as well.

OrinDyingAttacker_41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_41.text: I could end it now - but I'll be patient. Father will see us together again. He will see you bleed.
OrinDyingAttacker_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Toying with the player, trying to make them uneasy, establish her power over them. 'Father' is Bhaal.

OrinDyingAttacker_33.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_33.text: So you're the lickspittle who crushed the Bone Lord's thrall.
OrinDyingAttacker_33.context: NodeContext: First time Orin meets player. 'Bone Lord's thrall' is Ketheric, who player previously killed. Curious.

OrinDyingAttacker_11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_11.text: Have you come beg-begging, sniffing for our stones? Gortash won't like that. A throat his black hand can't choke the spit from.
OrinDyingAttacker_11.context: NodeContext: Mocking, finds your plan ridiculous but enjoys the chaos it will cause. 'Stones' are the netherstones. 'Black hand' reference to the 'Black Hand of Bane', Gortash's god.

OrinDyingAttacker_7.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_7.text: He will try to bind your brutality, to make you spin the suffering for his noose.
OrinDyingAttacker_7.context: NodeContext: Player chose to violently killl a dying man. 'He' refers to Gortash. Offering a 'friendly' warning that Gortash will try to turn the player's brutality to his advantage

OrinDyingAttacker_4.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_4.text: When you find the lordling, tell him Orin is watching.
OrinDyingAttacker_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Playful, menacing. Trying to make player uneasy - she could be hiding anywhere.

OrinDyingAttacker_73.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_73.text: He will sniff out your mercies, drag them forth and use them to dress his atrocities.
OrinDyingAttacker_73.context: NodeContext: Player chose to mercy kill the dying man. A 'friendly warning' that Gortash will turn the player's conscience against them.

OrinDyingAttacker_38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_38.text: He will not leave you bloodless for long. He will twitch you by the sinews, a puppet jerking and jabbing at his command.
OrinDyingAttacker_38.context: NodeContext: Player refused to kill the dying man. 'He' refers to Gortash, a 'friendly warning' that Gortash will exploit the player's conscience/unwillingness to shed blood.

OrinDyingAttacker_5.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_5.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.
OrinDyingAttacker_5.context: NodeContext: Second time Orin appeared to toy with you. She can't believe you're wasting so much time.

OrinDyingAttacker_17.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_17.text: Do not worry, slaughter-kin. My blades are still sharp and sweet. They will greet you soon enough.
OrinDyingAttacker_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Mocking reassurance - trying to make the player uneasy.

OrinDyingAttacker_72.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_72.text: Still rolling in the muck, I see.

OrinDyingAttacker_28.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_28.text: Gortash knows you are coming. Knows you have the Bone Lord's stone. Do not let him hiss hot air into your worm-weakened brain.
OrinDyingAttacker_28.context: NodeContext: Acting like she's helping you, but just trying to freak you out. 'Bone Lord's stone' is Ketheric's netherstone

OrinDyingAttacker_46.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinDyingAttacker_46.text: Remember - his throat spits lies, but my blade carves the truth. You will read it on your skin soon enough.
OrinDyingAttacker_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: toying with the player, knows the 'truth' about them and is enjoying holding this against them

OrinDyingAttacker_60.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_60.text: I'll make it quick. You won't feel a thing.

OrinDyingAttacker_3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player leans over the dying man, teasing the knife from his stomach. The dying man nods, giving the player permission.NodeContext: relieved, preparing to be put out of his misery

OrinDyingAttacker_19.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_19.text: That's the best you can do? So weak.
OrinDyingAttacker_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player dispatches the dying man (off camera). They appear upset/ unhappy at their task. We see the dead man still for a beat. Then he turns to us. The knife in the player's hand disintegrates - one of Orin's illusions.NodeContext: suddenly maniacal and malicious - responding to being stabbed, and shrugging it off. Menace on the emphasised weak

OrinDyingAttacker_13.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_13.text: Slit him open. Make him suffer. Make him scream.

OrinDyingAttacker_31.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_31.text: What are you doing? STOP... NO... ARGH!
OrinDyingAttacker_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player grips the knife in the dying man's stomach, and twists it violently. A smile spreads across their face as the man screams...NodeContext: first phrase shocked, on the capitalised words he's in agony as somebody literally twists the knife in his wound

OrinDyingAttacker_42.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: The man's screams turn to a giggle. The player steps back, confused, as the attacker grins.[LOGAN] Please record extra an amount of maniacal giggling / laughing V.O audio. NodeContext: sudden change from being in pain to giggling as if tickled

OrinDyingAttacker_52.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_52.text: Surrender to your urge. Slice him. Bleed him. Eviscerate him.

OrinDyingAttacker_29.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_29.text: Resist the urge rising within you. Let nature take its course.

OrinDyingAttacker_16.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_16.text: You used to take such pleasure in massacring the vulnerable.

OrinDyingAttacker_20.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_20.text: No. I won't have your blood on my hands.

OrinDyingAttacker_71.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_71.text: I serve you death on a plate, and still you refuse to eat.
OrinDyingAttacker_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dying man relaxes, his agonies apparently forgotten.NodeContext: goading

OrinDyingAttacker_26.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_26.text: Accusing innocent passers-by is an interesting survival strategy.

OrinDyingAttacker_69.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_DyingAttacker
OrinDyingAttacker_69.text: No one's innocent round here. Maybe you're better than most.

OrinDyingAttacker_12.speaker: Player
OrinDyingAttacker_12.text: How dare you - I'd never associate with such amateur work.

AD_SmithAwakens_0.speaker: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith
AD_SmithAwakens_0.text: Ungh... My head... All right, where are you?
AD_SmithAwakens_0.context: NodeContext: Initially groggy as though just regaining consciousness. Then angry - storming out to find someone who attacked you

Journalist_7.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_7.text: Ah! Are you trying to get into the city?
Journalist_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens has a pen and paper in hand, as if she's stood making notes/obsevations, and has stopped to talk to the player.NodeContext: Quick and eager,  not really giving the player chance to respond

Journalist_8.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_8.text: Got a minute to tell me about your experience at the gate today?

Journalist_32.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_32.text: Sounds about right. They're not letting anyone through without the proper permissions - Lord Gortash's orders.
Journalist_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens makes a quick note on her paper as she speaks

Journalist_3.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_3.text: I've been sent down here by my editor at the Baldur's Mouth Gazette to cover the chaos at the gate.

Journalist_2.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_2.text: He wants some fluff piece about the heroic Steel Watch keeping the mob at bay - whether or not that's the truth or not.
Journalist_2.context: NodeContext: Hint of derision - badmouthing her boss here

Journalist_38.speaker: Player
Journalist_38.text: And what do you think is the truth?

Journalist_28.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_28.text: That the refugees here are desperate, hungry, scared people. They're no mob - they just want to be safe.

Journalist_31.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_31.text: I've heard the rumours - Absolutists marching from Moonrise Towers, whole towns felled by strange curses. It's no wonder they ran.

Journalist_4.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_4.text: Of course, I can't write any of that. My editor only releases stories his friend Lord Gortash approves of, and he's very selective.

Journalist_42.speaker: Player
Journalist_42.text: I thought journalists were supposed to be impartial?

Journalist_33.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_33.text: We are, and I am. It's my editor who seems to have forgotten.

Journalist_11.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_11.text: Mr Needle's gotten pally with that Lord Gortash, and suddenly can't sing his praises highly enough.

Journalist_26.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_26.text: Seems like everything we write needs Gortash's approval. I can't recognise my own work by the time they're done 'editing.'

Journalist_40.speaker: Player
Journalist_40.text: That's appalling. So people in the city have no idea what's going on?

Journalist_30.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_30.text: Oh, they know some of it. Most would rather bury their heads in the sand anyway. Saves them the bother of feeling responsible.

Journalist_14.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_14.text: I'll try and get the truth across. Who knows, maybe a line or two will meet Mr Needle's approval. I won't be holding my breath.

Journalist_17.speaker: Player
Journalist_17.text: I'd love to speak with your editor. Where can I find him?

Journalist_25.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_25.text: At the Gazette's print house. Though it's in the Lower City, so you'll need to get past the gates first.

Journalist_1.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_1.text: Come to think of it, you remind me of someone he was writing a piece about.

Journalist_29.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_29.text: You, er, might want to speak to him about that. Set the record straight before the ink is dry, so to speak.

Journalist_19.speaker: Player
Journalist_19.text: Sounds like you're printing Gortash's propaganda.

Journalist_20.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_20.context: NodeContext: with a sigh - can't believe it's come to this

Journalist_16.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_16.text: Of course we're off the record and this conversation never happened.
Journalist_16.context: NodeContext: backing out - they've strayed into very dangerous territory with this conversation

Journalist_18.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_18.text: Now if you don't mind, I've got some edits to make.

Journalist_41.speaker: Player
Journalist_41.text: Have you considered that perhaps you're just not a very good writer?

Journalist_12.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_12.text: I'm going to ignore that comment, because clearly you aren't taking any of this seriously.
Journalist_12.context: NodeContext: Rising above it, a bit judgy

Journalist_6.speaker: Player
Journalist_6.text: Criticising the Steel Watch? That's not an opinion you hear often.

Journalist_22.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_22.text: If you read the Baldur's Mouth Gazette, it's an opinion you'll never  hear. Lord Gortash makes sure of that.

Journalist_45.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_45.text: My editor Mr Needle was a brilliant journalist, but recently... well, now he's got friends in high places, he seems more interested in keeping them happy.

Journalist_15.speaker: Player
Journalist_15.text: And I'm not interested at all. Goodbye.

Journalist_37.speaker: Player
Journalist_37.text: It was very good. The Fist were most accommodating.

Journalist_5.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_5.text: You're one of the lucky ones, then. Everyone else I've spoken to has been flat out refused - men, women, children, young and old. It's been chaos.
Journalist_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens makes a quick note on her paper as she speaks

Journalist_44.speaker: Player
Journalist_44.text: Slow down a second. Who are you?

Journalist_43.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_43.text: I'm Lens, roving reporter for the Baldur's Mouth Gazette. My editor's sent me to cover the drama out here at the gate.

Journalist_24.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_24.text: There was a skirmish a few days back - a band of Absolutists came close to entering the city. People started panicking, so the gate got closed.

Journalist_21.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_21.text: My editor at the Baldur's Mouth Gazette sent me down to get a first-hand account of the chaos.

Journalist_36.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_36.text: Aha. I see you don't trust journalists. Can't say I blame you.

Journalist_23.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_23.text: I'm not here to catch you out - I'm covering the closure of the gates for the Baldur's Mouth Gazette. My editor sent me.

Journalist_9.speaker: Lens the Journalist
Journalist_9.text: Sorry. Can't talk. I'm on a deadline.
Journalist_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens has a pen and paper in hand, as if she's stood making notes/obsevations, and has stopped to talk to the player.NodeContext: Brisk - too busy to chat

LINE_OrinAttacked_2.speaker: Orin
LINE_OrinAttacked_2.text: Again! Again! How sweet to feel my crimson spill.
LINE_OrinAttacked_2.context: NodeContext: with a shiver of delight - she likes that you were violent towards her

LINE_OrinAttacked_0.speaker: Orin
LINE_OrinAttacked_0.text: Ripen for me, slaughterer. I will make you perfect.
LINE_OrinAttacked_0.context: NodeContext: Encouraging you to keep being violent. Will disappear after this.

LINE_OrinAttacked_3.speaker: Orin
LINE_OrinAttacked_3.text: Ticklish little creature, tries to sneak and slice.
LINE_OrinAttacked_3.context: NodeContext: with a shiver of delight - she likes that you were violent towards her

LINE_OrinAttacked_5.speaker: Orin
LINE_OrinAttacked_5.text: Hack away, sweet meat. Let your butchery unfold.
LINE_OrinAttacked_5.context: NodeContext: Encouraging you to keep being violent. Will disappear after this.

LINE_OrinAttacked_4.speaker: Orin
LINE_OrinAttacked_4.text: Such blood hunger thickens your marrow.
LINE_OrinAttacked_4.context: NodeContext: with a shiver of delight - she likes that you were violent towards her

LINE_OrinAttacked_1.speaker: Orin
LINE_OrinAttacked_1.text: Find my temple. There it will be set free.
LINE_OrinAttacked_1.context: NodeContext: Instruction for player - can only fight at the Bhaal temple

OrinJournalist_33.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_33.text: Aren't you - I knew there was a story here, and there you are, the hero of the hour, walking right up to me.

OrinJournalist_65.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_65.text: The name's Lens, reporter with the Baldur's Mouth Gazette. Care to do a quick interview?
OrinJournalist_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Taking out a notebook and quillNodeContext: Pacy, excited - wants to get things moving quickly

OrinJournalist_24.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_24.text: Hold on. What do you want with me?

OrinJournalist_2.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_2.text: I'm here looking for my next angle, but it's all the same - oppression, famine, death. I need something new. Someone like you.

OrinJournalist_14.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_14.text: It won't take more than two moments of your time. If you play your cards right, this could make the cover. I just need some extra details.

OrinJournalist_68.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_68.text: So, you've arrived in Baldur's Gate. What's brought you here at a time like this?

OrinJournalist_89.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_89.text: I've come to save the city.

OrinJournalist_35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_35.text: You have? But I thought our soon-to-be Lord Gortash had things in hand?
OrinJournalist_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens makes some notes. [LOGAN] Check with Greg, V.O performance similar to established pose of Lens writing.

OrinJournalist_18.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_18.text: Though, if anyone could help him, it would be you. You've a knack for finding chinks in the Absolute's armour.

OrinJournalist_63.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_63.text: My life's in danger. I've come to find a way to save myself.

OrinJournalist_99.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_99.text: You came seeking safety in a city under siege? The threat must be dire indeed.
OrinJournalist_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens makes some notes. [LOGAN] Check with Greg, V.O performance similar to established pose of Lens writing.

OrinJournalist_69.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_69.text: Though from what I hear, you've little to fear from the Absolute.
OrinJournalist_69.context: NodeContext: mentioning "Th Absolute" here should sound like a pivot - she's assuming this is the threat referred to

OrinJournalist_40.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_40.text: Oh you know, taking a holiday, visiting family. Normal reasons.

OrinJournalist_37.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_37.text: Everybody needs a rest from time to time, even seasoned adventurers like yourself.
OrinJournalist_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens makes some notes. [LOGAN] Check with Greg, V.O performance similar to established pose of Lens writing.

OrinJournalist_72.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_72.text: I imagine you've a need to let off some steam after your recent adventures in the shadow-cursed lands.

OrinJournalist_31.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_31.text: My intentions aren't fit for printing. Trust me.

OrinJournalist_53.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_53.text: You're planning to indulge yourself in some of the darker corners of the city. No need to hide anything - we're all sinners by someone's yardstick.
OrinJournalist_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens makes some notes. [LOGAN] Check with Greg, V.O performance similar to established pose of Lens writing.

OrinJournalist_103.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_103.text: I... have to see an old acquaintance.

OrinJournalist_19.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_19.text: How wonderful. No doubt your reunion will be filled with tales from your recent adventures in the shadow-cursed lands.

OrinJournalist_67.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_67.text: Let's just say I'm here to leave my mark on the city. All will know of Gale of Waterdeep, soon enough.

OrinJournalist_55.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_55.text: Sounds like you're planning to make quite the impression. Only to be expected, given your feats in the shadow-cursed lands.

OrinJournalist_97.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_97.text: I live here. Or did, anyway. This homecoming has been a long time coming.

OrinJournalist_16.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_16.text: You must have been dreaming of this day for some time. No doubt the thought kept you going despite the perils you faced to get here.

OrinJournalist_26.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_26.text: My sources tell me you recently vanquished the fearsome General Ketheric Thorm. How did you manage that?

OrinJournalist_61.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_61.text: How in the Hells do you know about that?

OrinJournalist_52.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_52.text: I'm a journalist. It's my job to know everything.
OrinJournalist_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens makes some notes. [LOGAN] Check with Greg, V.O performance similar to established pose of Lens writing.

OrinJournalist_41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_41.text: Unfortunately the version I heard was light on details. So what did you do to Ketheric?

OrinJournalist_20.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_20.text: I fought with everything I had. He was a formidable foe wielding terrible power.

OrinJournalist_36.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_36.text: Formidable? You're just being modest. I heard you swatted him aside like a fly from a corpse.
OrinJournalist_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lens makes some notes. [LOGAN] Check with Greg, V.O performance similar to established pose of Lens writing.

OrinJournalist_22.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_22.text: You'll deal with the remaining Absolutists in much the same way, I suppose.

OrinJournalist_43.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_43.text: The cult's threat is far from extinguished. What's your plan of attack?

OrinJournalist_73.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_73.text: What makes you think I'm planning on attacking them?

OrinJournalist_91.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_91.text: I don't imagine they'll give you much choice, after you killed their general. Better to be on the front foot, surely?

OrinJournalist_11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_11.text: You must have some strategy in mind?

OrinJournalist_12.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_12.text: I'm going to cut that rotten cult off at the head - take out its leaders.

OrinJournalist_94.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_94.text: Gortash, maybe. You'll find me much harder to kill...
OrinJournalist_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a malicious smile. [LOGAN] Orin / Lens begins to drop the act. She winds down her writing.NodeContext: ominous

OrinJournalist_4.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_4.text: I've no interest in the Absolute. I'm here strictly on personal matters.

OrinJournalist_32.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a malicious smile. [LOGAN] Orin / Lens begins to drop the act. She winds down her writing.NodeContext: ominous

OrinJournalist_54.speaker: Player
OrinJournalist_54.text: Not much of a planner, I'm afraid. More of an improviser.

OrinJournalist_8.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Journalist
OrinJournalist_8.text: You think chaos courses through your veins? You have no idea...
OrinJournalist_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: With a malicious smile. [LOGAN] Orin / Lens begins to drop the act. She winds down her writing.NodeContext: ominous

OrinJournalist_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The journalist's body jerks as she transforms, wildshape-style into Orin the Red.

OrinJournalist_56.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_56.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
OrinJournalist_56.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

OrinJournalist_21.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_21.text: You come for mine too, slaughter-kin. And I hunger for yours.
OrinJournalist_21.context: NodeContext: Player previously revealed their plan to Orin. She knows they want her netherstone. Likes the idea they want to challenge her

OrinJournalist_1.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_1.text: Your purpose is clear as welts on an infant's skin: you come for our Netherstones next.
OrinJournalist_1.context: NodeContext: Player didn't tell Orin they want her netherstone - she thinks they lied, and is amused by it. Proof of how pathetic they are.

OrinJournalist_77.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_77.text: I could end it now - but I'll be patient. Father will see us together again. He will see you bleed.
OrinJournalist_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Toying with the player, trying to make them uneasy, establish her power over them. 'Father' is Bhaal.

OrinJournalist_23.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_23.text: So you're the lickspittle who crushed the Bone Lord's thrall.
OrinJournalist_23.context: NodeContext: First time Orin meets player. 'Bone Lord's thrall' is Ketheric, who player previously killed. Curious.

OrinJournalist_13.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_13.text: Have you come beg-begging, sniffing for our stones? Gortash won't like that. A throat his black hand can't choke the spit from.
OrinJournalist_13.context: NodeContext: Mocking, finds your plan ridiculous but enjoys the chaos it will cause. 'Stones' are the netherstones. 'Black hand' reference to the 'Black Hand of Bane', Gortash's god.

OrinJournalist_96.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_96.text: When you find the lordling, tell him Orin is watching.
OrinJournalist_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Playful, menacing. Trying to make player uneasy - she could be hiding anywhere.

OrinJournalist_82.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_82.text: I know the truth: you come for our Netherstones. Come to prise one from the tyrant's death grip, pluck the other from my rotted carcass.

OrinJournalist_101.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_101.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.
OrinJournalist_101.context: NodeContext: Second time Orin appeared to toy with you. She can't believe you're wasting so much time.

OrinJournalist_95.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_95.text: You think you're fit to wield the stones? A slipshod butcher, dull-skulled, unable to think, to create, to worship.
OrinJournalist_95.context: NodeContext: Player previously revealed their plan to Orin. Giving you a dressing down - all the ways you're inferior to her

OrinJournalist_48.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_48.text: You think you can hide your purpose. You are a brutish butcher, your blunted skull has no vision for deceit.
OrinJournalist_48.context: NodeContext: Player didn't tell Orin they want her netherstone - she thinks they lied. Giving you a dressing down - all the ways you're inferior to her. 'Blunted skull' alluding to the tadpole in your brain.

OrinJournalist_58.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_58.text: Do not worry, slaughter kin. My blades are still sharp and sweet. They will greet you soon enough.
OrinJournalist_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Mocking reassurance - trying to make the player uneasy.

OrinJournalist_83.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
OrinJournalist_83.text: Still rolling in the muck, I see.

OrinJournalist_17.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_OrinsImpersonation_Orin
